channel.title: Download speed
channel.description:
How long would you estimate this download to take with this speed [img]http://www.speedtest.net/result/2127616164.png[/img]
btw the download is Arma 2

item.title: Download speed
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“ggallin, post:13, topic:454886”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=557751.msg4081016#msg4081016 date=1345380592]
what exactly does sabnzbd do?
[/quote]
it’s kinda like usenet’s version of utorrent. it’s a downloading client.[/quote]does it help to enhance the speed or just hide the size of file from isp? (which I don’t see how honestly )

Read full topic

item.title: Download speed
item.dc:creator: @ggallin ggallin
item.description:
@ggallin wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:14, topic:454886”][quote author=ggallin link=topic=557751.msg4080863#msg4080863 date=1345352353]
if you have a slow speed then usenet is the way to go. buy a usenet provider with ssl encryption too so you don’t get in trouble. I’ve only used a 3 day trial from hitnews.com so i never had the benifit of ssl. Also use sabnzbd. your isp can’t throttle what it can’t see.
[/quote]

I use usenet myself but it’s definitely better for HIGHER speeds not SLOWER.[/quote]
not… really. the connections don’t require seeding and the files are always there. Unless your retention is highly limited. so you’d have a better chance at getting the file and getting it faster.

Read full topic

item.title: Download speed
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

your download speed in the OP is in bits, so divide by 8 to get the bytes/s. from that it’s a simple as dividing that by the download size (check your units) then coverting from seconds to minutes/hours.

Read full topic

item.title: Download speed

item.description:

if you have a slow speed then usenet is the way to go. buy a usenet provider with ssl encryption too so you don’t get in trouble. I’ve only used a 3 day trial from hitnews.com so i never had the benifit of ssl. Also use sabnzbd. your isp can’t throttle what it can’t see.

I use usenet myself but it’s definitely better for HIGHER speeds not SLOWER.

item.title: Download speed
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:8, topic:454886”][quote author=TabbyKiller link=topic=557751.msg4080761#msg4080761 date=1345343564]
Minus all of the speed droppage (thanks to my isp) it can be done if the download starts around 11.00pm - 4.00pm? Easily by the sounds of it. Thanks guys
[/quote]yeah I would start it about 5-6pm it should be ready in the morning for sure.

If your isp lowers your speed for downloading only 14gb though you really should consider somebody else…[/quote]
The ISP I am on right now is the best I can get in my country. They’re working on installing fiber optic as I see them working outside right now. But I’m sure they wont activate it for a few months.

Read full topic

item.title: Download speed
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:3, topic:454886”]14.8GB[/quote]I’d say…

just rough estimating of course

5 x 60 seconds = 1 minute = 30mb.
So…
30mb x 60 minutes = 1800mb(1.8gb)
so…
14.8 divided by 1.8gb = I would say roughly about 8-10 hours

Read full topic
